comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Dr. Walter Frederick Matthews obituary: DEATH OF DR. W. F. MATTHEWS - "ORANGE, Sunday. - Dr. Walter Frederick Matthews died suddenly at Orange tonight. He was 69. Dr. Matthews, who practised in Orange for 34 years, was an alderman of Orange City Council for 19 years and mayor for 12 years. He was active in Rugby Union football and managed the 1933 Australian team in South Africa and the 1939 Wallabies. Earlier, he served in World War 1 as a medical officer, and before returning to Australia managed the A.I.F. team which toured England, France, and Scotland. He is survived by Mrs. Matthews and one son, Dr. Robert Matthews." - The Sydney Morning Herald, Monday 15 February 1954, p. 14.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thanks for adding this obituary, he had a very busy and interesting life.
